comment: Just put in the work and you will do fine, he is a good professor

He loves to use the phrase "I have 300+ students" to justify being unreasonably inflexible. He is extremely passive aggressive and borderline rude to students who email him respectfully with questions. Frankly, I think he should find another profession if he has such an issue with teaching 300+ students, as that is what a professor does. 0/5 stars.

Overall this class is pretty straight forward and if you pay attention and follow the directions and due dates you will do great. He does come off a little strict, only because people don't follow directions and ask questions that were explained. He is very fast to respond to emails and help with issues that arise throughout the semester!
rating_tags: Tough grader--Clear grading criteria--Gives good feedback

comment: 12 Quiz, 12 Labs, 2 Big Discussions posts, Midterm, and final. Rocky start with miscommunication about how the labs should be submitted so PAY ATTENTION to LAB FORMATTING or you will get a zero with no questions asked. Exams are open everything so take advantage. He's a decent professor a little passive aggressive but great all around.

I had the pleasure of taking a course with Zahirovic and it was a great experience. His lessons were incredibly insightful, offering not just theoretical knowledge but also practical applications that made the material engaging and easy to understand. He has excellent communication skills, making even complex topics clear and accessible.

The professor miscalculated my final grade last semester, and advised him to review the calculation made , which he refused to do. He had some attitude while emailing and ignored my emails. I had to submit an appeal to the  chair and dean office to be heard and approved. Very bad attitude for a new professor.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Lots of homework--Graded by few things

comment: He is a relatively new professor. He does a great job at communicating. His class is setup really well in terms of due dates and if any changes happen he will make sure you know. If you take his class be ready to do lots of labs that do a great job at teaching you Linux. Main issue I have is his discussions are not setup well it is confusing.
